overview_of_class: In this course you will study and explore elastic theory, wave equation, seismic waves, seismic wave propagation, seismic ray paths, seismic reflections & refractions, seismic reflection coefficients, seismometers, seismic travel times, seismograms, and what seismic waves tell us about the internal structure of the Earth.
name: Seismology and Earth Structure
title: WCAS EARTH 323-0-01 Seismology and Earth Structure

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: In this course you will study and explore elastic theory, wave equation, seismic waves, seismic wave propagation, seismic ray paths, seismic reflections & refractions, seismic reflection coefficients, seismometers, seismic travel times, seismograms, and what seismic waves tell us about the internal structure of the Earth.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Calculus (functions, differentiation, integration, Taylor expansion, etc.), ordinary differential equations, and some exposure to complex numbers. All science and engineering majors and minors are welcome; no prior geology experience is needed. Effective NU prerequisites: (MATH 220, 224, 230, and 250 and PHYS 135-1, 135-2, & 135-3) or permission of instructor.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
An Introduction to Seismology, Earthquakes and Earth Structure
ISBN: 978-0-865-42078-6 (0-865-42078-5)
Pub date:© 2003
Paper 512 Pages
List Price: $129.95

subject: EARTH
